Article.Abstract: CD8(+) T lymphocytes play a major role in the clearance of respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infections. To be able to study the primary CTL response in RSV-infected children, epitopes presented by a set of commonly used HLA alleles (HLA-A1, -A3, -B44 and -B51) were searched for. Five epitopes were characterized derived from the matrix (M), non-structural (NS2) and second matrix (M2) proteins of RSV. All epitopes were shown to be processed and presented by RSV-infected antigen-presenting cells. HLA-A1 tetramers for one of these epitopes derived from the M protein were constructed and used to quantify and phenotype the memory CD8(+) T cell pool in a panel of healthy adult donors. In about 60 % of the donors, CD8(+) T cells specific for the M protein could be identified. These cells belonged to the memory T cell subset characterized by expression of CD27 and CD28, and down-regulation of CCR7 and CD45RA. The frequency of tetramer-positive cells varied between 0.4 and 3 per 10(4) CD8(+) T cells in PBMC of healthy asymptomatic adult donors.
Article.ArticleTitle: Human CD8(+) T cell responses against five newly identified respiratory syncytial virus-derived epitopes.
Article.Affiliations: Division of Pediatrics, Wilhelmina Children's Hospital, University Medical Center, KE 04.133.1, PO Box 85500, 3508 AB Utrecht, The Netherlands; Division of Pulmonology and the Department of Experimental Immunology, Academic Medical Center, Amsterdam, The Netherlands; The Netherlands Vaccine Institute, Bilthoven, The Netherlands; Division of Clinical Immunology, Academic Medical Center, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: CCR7 protein, human;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;HLA Antigens;Receptors, CCR7;Receptors, Chemokine
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Adult; Alleles; Binding Sites; CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte; HLA Antigens(genetics; physiology); Humans; Immunologic Memory; Immunophenotyping; Receptors, CCR7; Receptors, Chemokine(physiology); Respiratory Syncytial Viruses(immunology)

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ T cells from 7 of 13 HLA-A1 positive donors expanded after stimulating with the epitope in vitro as measured by tetramer staining.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

AssayInformation.AssayComments: All the tetramer positive cells were CD45RA dull, CD27+, CD28+ and about 80% were CCR7-.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from healthy donors were stimulated with the epitope on day 0 or on days 0 and 10.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ T cells from donors strongly responded to the epitope by releasing IFN-g after restimulating with the epitope on day 10, compared with "no restimulating" group.
